p: The rash starts behind the ears and spreads to the face and trunk within 24 h. The rash is deep pink or red in color, appeared in blotches scattered as little islands with unaffected skin between, and is pruritic. The rash then spreads to cover the entire body in about 3 days (Kilbourne 1967). It is unusual for the rash to persist more than 5–7 days, and when it fades the skin appears dry while the superficial layers scale off. The fever usually lasts 5–7 days. Within 5 days of the appearance of the rash, most children are up and about (Towsley 1947).
